title: Main relationships
text: page, ’ll fitting different models using generalized additive models (GAM’s) using mgcv package modeling non-linear relationships, even though can used model linear relationships . smoothing parameter (one gets decide wiggly curve) estimated using restricted maximum likelihood (.e., REML).

title: Main relationships
text: interpretation summary GAM models R can seen short video (~ 4 minutes) datacamp. However, let’s get short intro fast interpretation! small part summary output shows influence edad_cronologica_meses significant p-value <2e-16. edf stands “Effective Degrees Freedom” reflects complex (wiggly) relationship . Thus, edf 1 reflects linear relationship, edf 2 reflects cuadratic relationship, edf 3 cubic relationship . information GAMs can seen : Generalized Additive Models, Michael Clark: website. Nonlinear Models R: Wonderful World mgcv, Noam Ross: youtube.
code: Approximate significance of smooth terms:                             edf Ref.df     F p-value     s(edad_cronologica_meses) 6.475  7.561 28.98  <2e-16 *** --- Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Main relationships
text: Model: comunicacion_total ~ edad_cronologica_meses
code: plot_gam(data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_cronologica_meses <= 60],           x = edad_cronologica_meses,           y = comunicacion_total,           ylab = "Communication",           xlab = "Months old",          round_to = 5,          method = "REML") library(mgcv) #> Loading required package: nlme #> This is mgcv 1.8-40. For overview type 'help("mgcv-package")'. mgcv::gam(formula = comunicacion_total ~ s(edad_cronologica_meses),           data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_cronologica_meses <= 60],           method = "REML") |>    summary() #>  #> Family: gaussian  #> Link function: identity  #>  #> Formula: #> comunicacion_total ~ s(edad_cronologica_meses) #>  #> Parametric coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  38.3126     0.5381    71.2   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                             edf Ref.df     F p-value     #> s(edad_cronologica_meses) 6.475  7.561 28.98  <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.214   Deviance explained =   22% #> -REML = 3333.9  Scale est. = 232.5     n = 803

what: Problem solving score & chronological age (in months)
title: Main relationships
text: Model: resolucion_problemas_total ~ edad_cronologica_meses
code: plot_gam(data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_cronologica_meses <= 60],           x = edad_cronologica_meses,           y = resolucion_problemas_total,           ylab = "Problem solving",           xlab = "Months old",          round_to = 5,          method = "REML") mgcv::gam(formula = resolucion_problemas_total ~ s(edad_cronologica_meses),           data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_cronologica_meses <= 60],           method = "REML") |>    summary() #>  #> Family: gaussian  #> Link function: identity  #>  #> Formula: #> resolucion_problemas_total ~ s(edad_cronologica_meses) #>  #> Parametric coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  39.7883     0.5044   78.88   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                             edf Ref.df     F p-value     #> s(edad_cronologica_meses) 8.052  8.726 16.14  <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.148   Deviance explained = 15.7% #> -REML = 3287.6  Scale est. = 204.33    n = 803

title: Main relationships
text: Model: comunicacion_total ~ semanas_prematurez
code: plot_gam(data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1],           x = semanas_prematurez,           y = comunicacion_total,           ylab = "Communication",          xlab = "Prematurity (in weeks)",           round_to = 2,          method = "REML") mgcv::gam(formula = comunicacion_total ~ s(semanas_prematurez),           data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1],           method = "REML") |>    summary() #>  #> Family: gaussian  #> Link function: identity  #>  #> Formula: #> comunicacion_total ~ s(semanas_prematurez) #>  #> Parametric coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  38.2649     0.6032   63.44   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                         edf Ref.df     F p-value    #> s(semanas_prematurez) 3.274  4.034 3.428 0.00848 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.016   Deviance explained =    2% #> -REML = 3424.2  Scale est. = 292.51    n = 804

title: Main relationships
text: Model: comunicacion_total ~ edad_corregida_meses
code: plot_gam(data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_corregida_meses <= 60],           x = edad_corregida_meses,           y = comunicacion_total,           ylab = "Communication",          xlab = "Corrected age (months old)",           round_to = 5,          method = "REML") mgcv::gam(formula = comunicacion_total ~ s(edad_corregida_meses),           data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1 & edad_corregida_meses <= 60],           method = "REML") |>    summary() #>  #> Family: gaussian  #> Link function: identity  #>  #> Formula: #> comunicacion_total ~ s(edad_corregida_meses) #>  #> Parametric coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  38.3126     0.5377   71.25   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                           edf Ref.df     F p-value     #> s(edad_corregida_meses) 6.582  7.675 28.76  <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.215   Deviance explained = 22.2% #> -REML = 3333.5  Scale est. = 232.18    n = 803

what: Fine motor skills score & corrected age (in months)

Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)   41.681      0.477   87.38   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                           edf Ref.df     F p-value     #> s(edad_corregida_meses) 4.277  5.263 8.813  <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.0539   Deviance explained =  5.9% #> -REML = 3232.9  Scale est. = 182.7     n = 803

what: Communication score & developmental ASQ-3 age (in months)
title: Main relationships
text: Model: comunicacion_total ~ asq3_meses

Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  38.2649     0.5415   70.67   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                 edf Ref.df     F p-value     #> s(asq3_meses) 6.235  7.386 28.42  <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.207   Deviance explained = 21.3% #> -REML = 3342.8  Scale est. = 235.71    n = 804

what: Gross motor skills score score & Communication score
title: Main relationships
text: Model: motora_gruesa_total ~ comunicacion_total  Looks like linear relationship non-linear one. notorious look effective degrees freedom (edf), .e. closer 1 alike linear regression.
code: plot_gam(data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1],           x = comunicacion_total,           y = motora_gruesa_total,           ylab = "Gross motor skills",          xlab = "Communication",           round_to = 5,          method = "REML") mgcv::gam(formula = motora_gruesa_total ~ s(comunicacion_total),           data = dataset[n_evaluacion == 1],           method = "REML") |>    summary() #>  #> Family: gaussian  #> Link function: identity  #>  #> Formula: #> motora_gruesa_total ~ s(comunicacion_total) #>  #> Parametric coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  39.3159     0.6341   62.01   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Approximate significance of smooth terms: #>                         edf Ref.df     F  p-value     #> s(comunicacion_total) 1.004  1.008 17.95 2.48e-05 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> R-sq.(adj) =  0.0208   Deviance explained =  2.2% #> -REML = 3461.8  Scale est. = 323.23    n = 804

text: purpose {ASQ3} package provide access data collected Centro Asistencial Docente e Investigación de la Universidad de Magallanes (CADI-UMAG). data treated, eliminating sensitive information compromise identity participants linked individuals. Data preparation process can seen .

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: dataset preparation process occurs several steps, involve manual processing data using Excel programmatic preparation using R. programmatic part steps used data treatment detailed .

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: original data available package, given sensitive nature information, requests evaluated.

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: data entry using Excel complete, imported R using read_excel function readxl package.  Subsequently, column names changed syntactically valid versions, case camel case (e.g. "Column " "column_a").  completed, data transformed `data.table' format, allows efficient implementation function (functions) across multiple columns (using selection criteria greater precision).
code: dataset <- readxl::read_excel("data-raw/raw-data.xlsx") names(dataset) <- readLines("data-raw/helpers/colnames") dataset <- data.table::setDT(dataset)

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: real world dataset, data entry errors common. context, able handle crucial cleaning step first import dataset. , separate csv file used, four columns: param_in: variable need filter get exact case error introduced. search_for: query passed param_in filter subsetting. param_out: variable correction needed. replace: correction . structure, data entry errors handled follow: every row csv file corrections, filter param_in using search_for select case(s) error occur; , replace de value param_out using replace. code aforementioned details can seen :
code: corrections <- read.csv("data-raw/helpers/corrections.csv") n <- nrow(corrections)  # `fecha_evaluacion` as character (latter on will be transformed to date format) dataset[, fecha_evaluacion := as.character(fecha_evaluacion)]  for (i in seq_len(n)) {   i_var <- corrections[i, "param_in"]    ind <- data.table::like(     vector = dataset[[i_var]],     pattern = corrections[i, "search_for"],     ignore.case = TRUE   )    data.table::set(     x = dataset,     i = which(ind),     j = corrections[i, "param_out"],     value = corrections[i, "replace"]   ) }

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: import complete, proceeded standardise formatting columns using regular expressions (RegEx) select columns, starting modification text variables.
code: col_names <- names(dataset) # getting the column names  # Processing date variables ind <- grep("fecha", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, fecha_nacimiento := as.numeric(fecha_nacimiento)] dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, data.table::as.IDate, origin = "1899-12-30"), .SDcols = ind]  # Labels to "title-case" ind <- grep("nombre|interpretacion|especialidad", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, stringr::str_to_title), .SDcols = ind]  # Labels to "lower-case" ind <- grep("agrupacion|diagnostico", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, tolower), .SDcols = ind]  # numerical variables ind <- grep("total", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, as.numeric), .SDcols = ind]  # asq3_meses to numeric dataset[, asq3_meses := as.numeric(x = gsub("MESES", "", asq3_meses))]  # Add patient sex dataset <- merge(   x = dataset,   y = fread("data-raw/helpers/rut_sex.csv"),   by = "rut_paciente", )

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: order treat maintain confidentiality identity patients, well evaluating professionals, identifying number assigned individual, excluding process RUT name missing (.e. missing data).
code: # ID for each professional dataset[, profesional_id := as.numeric(x = factor(profesional_nombre))]  # and then we eliminate the column with their name dataset[, profesional_nombre := NULL]  # ID for each patient dataset[, paciente_id := as.numeric(x = factor(rut_paciente))]  # and then we eliminate the column with their name dataset[, nombre_paciente := NULL]  # and the the column with their RUT dataset[, rut_paciente := NULL]  # Also eliminate the column with the responder's name dataset[, nombre_respondedor := NULL]

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: raw data, age patients months weeks prematurity, allows us calculate corrected age patients months, latter calculated using auxiliary function.
code: # Custom function edad_corregida <- function(x, y) {   # standardize number of weeks in a month   weeks_in_a_month <- 4.34524    # Months old to weeks old   weeks_old <- x * weeks_in_a_month    # Correction as [weeks old] - [preterm weeks]   corrected_weeks <- weeks_old - y    # Then change back to months the corrected age   corrected_monts <- corrected_weeks / weeks_in_a_month    # Finally, return the rounded values   round(corrected_monts) }  # Compute the column with the corrected age using previous function dataset[, edad_corregida_meses := edad_corregida(edad_cronologica_meses, semanas_prematurez)]

title: Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
code: dataset

title: Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
text: data frame 1523 rows y 53 variables: profesional_id: Factor. Identifying number assessing professional. profesional_especialidad: Factor. Profession professional evaluator. paciente_id: Factor. Patient identifier number. sexo_paciente: Factor. Patient's sex. respondedor_vinculo: Factor. Type relationship respondent patient. evaluacion_tipo: Factor. Type assessment. fecha_evaluacion: Date. Date patient assessment. fecha_nacimiento: Date. Patient's date birth. edad_cronologica_meses: Numeric. Chronological age patient months. semanas_prematurez: Numeric. Weeks prematurity. edad_corregida_meses: Numeric. Chronological age patient months corrected weeks prematurity. diagnostico: Character. Patient's diagnostic group. asq3_meses: Numeric. Age months patient development according ASQ 3. comunicacion_q1 - comunicacion_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions communication item. comunicacion_total: Numeric. Total score communication item. comunicacion_interpretacion: Factor. Interpretation communication item. motora_gruesa_q1 - motora_gruesa_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions gross motor skills item. motora_gruesa_total: Numeric. Total score gross motor skills item. motora_gruesa_interpretacion: Factor. Interpretation gross motor skills item. motora_fina_q1 - motora_fina_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions fine motor skills item. motora_fina_total: Numeric. Total score fine motor skills item. motora_fina_interpretacion: Factor. Interpretation fine motor skills item. resolucion_problemas_q1 - resolucion_problemas_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions problem solving item. resolucion_problemas_total: Numeric. Total score problem solving item. resolucion_problemas_interpretacion: Factor. Interpretation problem solving item. socio_individual_q1 - socio_individual_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions socio-individual skills item. socio_individual_total: Numeric. Total score socio-individual skills item. socio_individual_interpretacion: Factor. Interpretation socio-individual skills item.
